description: The Phoenician city of Akko was re-founded by Ptolemy II Philadelphos from ca. 285-246 B.C.
details: The Barrington Atlas Directory notes: Tell Acco ISR

properties.description: Excavations on site of post office at 49 Ben Ami St. revealed Hellenistic remains,  including a dedication to Zeus Soter on behalf of Antiochos VII by a courtier (SEG XIX 9094). This inscription was associated with Hellenistic architecture of a temple-like character. Nearby workshops also uncovered.
properties.title: Location of Re-Buried Hellenistic Temple and Workshops

locations.title: DARE Location

locations.description: Excavations on site of post office at 49 Ben Ami St. revealed Hellenistic remains,  including a dedication to Zeus Soter on behalf of Antiochos VII by a courtier (SEG XIX 9094). This inscription was associated with Hellenistic architecture of a temple-like character. Nearby workshops also uncovered.

history.comment: Edited

All three references describe Hellenistic architectural remains at the site of the current Post Office at 49 Ben Ami St. in Akko. The remains are buried. Abu Hamid 2012 summarizes further rescue excavations around that site.
Add reference to the accuracy assessment doc
Edited
Initial revision
